result.execSummary:
The defendant Michael S Finn was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • Resisting or Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
Fine to be paid as a Condition of Probation.

If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.
Submit to an AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment/counseling.

Be compliant with all orders with competent jurisdiction.
No contact with the victim or co-defendant.
Not to be on premises where the incident occurred.
DNA surcharge is WAIVED.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Michael S Finn in court with attorney Joan B Broughton.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Parties proceed to sentencing on Cts. 1 and 2. 

Court orders the following: 
Ct. 1:
- 90 days jail straight time consecutive to Ct. 2 STAYED for 18 months Probation - concurrent to Ct. 2
- Fine totaling $883.00 to be paid as a Condition of Probation; alternate 18 days jail consecutive 
- Conditions of  Probation:  Submit to a formal AODA assessment and follow through with any treatment/counseling. Be compliant with all orders of courts with competent jurisdiction. No contact with the victim or co-defendant. Not be on premises where the incident occurred.  DNA surcharge is waived.

Ct. 2:
- 90 days jail straight time consecutive to Ct. 1 STAYED for 18 months Probation - concurrent to Ct. 1
- Court costs totaling $243.00 to be paid as a Condition of Probation; alternate 5 days jail consecutive 
- Conditions of  Probation:  Submit to a formal AODA assessment and follow through with any treatment/counseling. Be compliant with all orders of courts with competent jurisdiction. No contact with the victim or co-defendant. Not be on premises where the incident occurred.  DNA surcharge is waived.
Sentencing hearing on July 23, 2014 at 10:30 am.

Defendant Michael S Finn in court with attorney Joan B Broughton.  Kevin M. Osborne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Amended Information filed. Defendant enters a plea of no contest to Counts 1 and 2,  Court finds defendant guilty. Defense requests another date for sentencing. Court grants request.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for July 23, 2014 at 10:30 am.
Jury trial - 12 person on July 15, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Jury status hearing on July 10, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Michael S Finn in court with attorney Joan B Broughton.  Ted S Szczupakiewicz appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Atty. Broughton just received the pretrial offer and requests another date. Court will put the matter on the status/trial calendar.  Jury status hearing scheduled for July 10, 2014 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial - 12 person scheduled for July 15, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Michael S Finn in court with attorney Joan B Broughton.  Kevin M Osborne appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense advises they don't have an offer yet and requests another date with the co-defendant - 14CF139. Court grants request. State will be making an offer. Court will give another date in 2 - 3 weeks. Hearing scheduled for May 16, 2014.

Defendant Michael S Finn in court with attorney Joan B. Broughton.  Kevin M. Osborne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case called with codefendant.  Defense moves for exclusion.  Court grants.  Witnesses leave the courtroom.  Deputy Kent Krause sworn in and testified.  Deputy Garret Grulke sworn in and testified.  Deputy Brandee Piper sworn in and testified.  State moves for bind over.  Defense moves for dismissal and presents arguments.    Court find probable cause to believe that a felony was committed and binds the defendant over for trial.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED. 
  Hearing scheduled for April 17, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Preliminary hearing on March 20, 2014 at 10:00 am.

Defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol. Defendant to not be in any establishment that sells or serves alcoholic beverages other than a grocery store.   Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription. Defendant to have no contact with Daniel C. or Stephen W. listed in criminal complaint.
Waukesha County Pretrial Screening Services Report by Wisconsin Community Services filed.

Defendant Michael S Finn in court, in custody, with attorney Joan Broughton.    District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant is eligible for State Public Defender representation.  An attorney will be appointed.     Preliminary Hearing requested.  Preliminary time limits waived.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 20, 2014 at 10:00 am.
